tool_description: MMseqs2 (Many-against-Many sequence searching) is a fast and sensitive tool for clustering large protein sequence datasets. It groups similar sequences into clusters, which can be useful for reducing redundancy and identifying representative sequences.

required_parameters.name: protein_sequence
required_parameters.description: A set of protein sequences to be clustered using MMseqs2.

optional_parameters.name: identity
optional_parameters.description: The sequence identity threshold for clustering. Sequences with identity above this threshold will be grouped into the same cluster.

return_values.name: protein_clusters
return_values.description: The resulting clusters of protein sequences, where each cluster represents a group of similar sequences.
